intro: Dracophyllum affine, commonly known as the dwarf heath, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of pink or white flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions. Dracophyllum affine is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
